alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:31AM EST until January 12 at 2:35AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Carolina... Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. At 18.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. The Smithfield town park and the Neuse Riverwalk at the US70 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The river crested at 16.9 feet this morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 9.4 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 16.7 Thu 7 am EST 9.8 9.3 11.1 11.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 945 AM EST.
